name: Cautley Spout
description:
The highest (*above ground) cascade waterfall in England.

Approach

Free parking in the lay-by near The Temperance Inn.

Obvious, but steep, approach trail to the top of The Calf plateau. The beck is forked near the top - ignore and cross the first stream (on the trail), then begin your descent when the trail meets the next one.

Descent

Exit

Egress from the stream on river left. Return via the same trail used for approach.

Red tape

There are concerns about erosion. No restrictions in place at present.

Beta sites

More information can be found through UK Canyon Guides Association (?)

Trip reports and media

Commercial trips are run - videos are up on youtube.

Background

Very slippery inside the canyon. Care should be taken with the moss and vegetation inside the canyon - quite fragile.

Double bolted on all but one drop (that isn't a mandatory rap). Maillons on rappel points (one 10m rappel has a pearshaped maillon). All anchors seem well placed so edge protection concerns are low.

Small water cachement area.
